page.title: 16BIRD LIFE OF LLANBISTER
page.content: Bracken and rough grassland of the common is the haunt of Larks, Meadow Pippet, Stonechats, Curlews and Lapwing. Linnets nest in gorse and Cuckoos seek their hosts. Circling Buzzards, hovering Kestrels and occasionally Merlin hunt Field Mice, Bank Voles, and Shrews. The farmed land notably has a concentraction of Tawny Owls, summer visiting Redstarts and Spotted Flycatchers.Willow Warblers,Tree creepers, and Nuthatches are common, Chiff Chaff and the Green and Greater Spotted Woodpecker rare. Summer migrants include Swifts, Swallows, Sand and House Martins, Wheatears and Whinchats. Flocks of Fieldfare and Redwing feast on berries. Winter brings Blue,Marsh and Coal Tits, Chaffinches and Greenfinches. The river has Dippers,Heron and Kingfisher
